revised_title: In Utero Transmission of Smallpox: A Case Study
tldr: This case study reports a unique instance where a pregnant woman contracted smallpox and passed the infection to her unborn child. The child was born with smallpox on its entire body and unfortunately died three days after birth. The mother recovered, and this case highlights the potential risks of smallpox transmission during pregnancy.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Infectious Diseases
